title: Does Christoph Waltz speak Italian? - Quora

response.answer_text: If you read Christoph Waltz of 'Inglourious Basterds': The Austrian-born Waltz speaks three languages fluently -- German, French and English -- and can fake Italian pretty well, as "Inglourious Basterds" (Aug. 21) proves. That said: after listening a few times at his (undubbed) line in Inglorious Bastards, I’d say he exercised quite a lot in saying it properly with the voice tone, stress and pauses that are appropriate for the role he’s playing, especially the last part — while in the first part of his line “Signori, è un piacere! Gli amici della vedetta ammirata da tutti noi, questa gemma propria della nostra cultura” he almost omits the è un between Signori and piacere, and also does not pause between noi and questa. Nonetheless, he’s still quite good in faking it, because I can’t hear any German or French inflexion in it. By comparison, Brad Pitt sounds absolutely ridiculous saying his Buongiorno! (he sounds as if he was some rude herdsman who just came down from his horse…).

I don't know him personally but if you watch inglourious Basterds, in the cinema when he talks to Enzo Gorlomi (Brad Pitt) he speaks Italian…now, he speaks very fast to create the illusion of fluency and to increase the effect of the scene…in reality the first time I heard it I had to rewind it…because I couldn't understand a word…so my answer is…at a very basic level…if I am wrong…i apologize to colonel Hans Landa…
In the press conference they gave at Cannes he said he only spoke German, French and English he rehearsed a lot for that particular line.
